fields.name: Standups
fields.desc: A regular team collaboration opportunity for sharing progress, identifying risks and resolving issues

fields.name: Retrospectives
fields.desc: A team activity used for problem identification and solution forming the basis for continuous improvement

fields.name: Backlog Management
fields.desc: Teams need a single backlog of work to pull work from. This backlog needs be kept relevant.

fields.name: Product Ownership
fields.desc: Compulsory for Product Teams

fields.name: Iteration Management
fields.desc: Enforces a disciplined approach to agile values/principles and practices within a delivery team

fields.name: Track & Visualise Progress
fields.desc:
Principles
1. Visible to leadership, onshore/offshore teams
2. Any one in the team should be able to update the wall and visualize the progress
3. Shows Parameters from the Iteration Report
4. Risks and Blockers: effective tracking mechanism with the dates/accountability info
5. Data is up to date

fields.name: Showcases
fields.desc:
Engaging the customer through showcases, planning, progress and team meetings to support definition and prioritisation.
For projects, Customer = Product Owner

fields.name: Building Quality In
fields.desc: A definition of quality provides the basis for assessing the suitability of work delivered

fields.name: Adaptive Planning
fields.desc: The collaborative identification, definition and planning of work and deliverables

fields.name: Risk Management
fields.desc: Risk management addresses uncertainty and increases the likelihood of successful outcomes

fields.name: Regressive
fields.desc: • Stand-up's are not occurring

fields.name: Emerging
fields.desc:
• Stand-up's occur but are irregular (-)
• Team lacking understanding of purpose of Stand Up (-)
• Stand Ups go overtime (-)
• Team members are unclear what work is happening or issues blocking progress (-)
• Team members typically perform additional reporting to highlight work completed (-)
• Core team attendance maybe intermittent (-)
• Team member updates are focus only on status with limited insight into risks or issues (-)
• Distributed team members not included (-)

fields.name: Growing
fields.desc:
(Includes items from Emerging marked with (+))

• Stand-up meetings occur regularly but are usually initiated by the Iteration Manager/Project Manager or another facilitator (-)
• At each meeting, all of the core team members answer the questions "What I have done since we last met", "What I plan to do before we next meet", "What is blocking me or may block me" (+)
• Geographically remote team members are involved in Stand-up meetings (+)

fields.name: Sustainable
fields.desc:
(Includes items from Growing marked with (+))

• Stand-up's occur daily
• Stand-up meetings are rarely missed by any core team member and still occur regardless of attendance 
• Core team members use the visual wall and point to the work they are doing while answering the 3 questions 
• Stand-up's are completed in under 15mins 
• Project stakeholders regularly attend stand-ups and other team collaboration events 
• Geographically remote team members feel properly included in Stand-up's and are able to see and hear progress updates 
• Blockers and challenges identified during the stand-up are assigned an owner, so that the impediment can be removed 
• Visual wall is updated as agreed by the whole team

fields.name: Regressive
fields.desc: • No Retrospectives occur

fields.name: Emerging
fields.desc:
• Retrospectives happen but are irregular (-)
• Retrospectives have poorly defined or no follow-up actions (-)
• Decisions are taken with limited consideration of evidence or facts (-)
• Actions are not followed through or are ineffective (-)

fields.name: Growing
fields.desc:
(Includes items from Emerging marked with (+))

• Retrospectives are regular with actions being generated (+)
• Retrospectives are generally facilitated by the same person (-)
• Retrospective attendance is inconsistent (-)

fields.name: Sustainable
fields.desc:
(Includes items from Growing marked with (+))

• Retrospectives are consistently attended by the core team who actively contribute to concrete actions
• Actions are incorporated into work planning and their timely completion contributes to improvement
• Decisions are fact-based, addressing the root-cause of the problems
• Actions from previous retrospective are reviewed

fields.name: Regressive
fields.desc:
• No backlog exists
• Multiple Backlogs

fields.name: Emerging
fields.desc:
• Single Backlog exists (+)
• Tasks based; not values based (-)
• Not prioritised (-)
• No estimates (-)

fields.name: Growing
fields.desc:
• Items on backlog are outcome focused (+)
• Relative Estimates Exists (+)
• Backlog not groomed regularly (-)
• Trade-off sliders are understood by all and used to guide decisions relating to Time, Cost, Scope and Quality (+)

fields.name: Sustainable
fields.desc:
• Backlog is a manageable size
• Prioritised based on business value and risk
• Relative Estimates exists for next 2 iterations
• Backlog is regularly groomed (preferably for each Iteration Planning Meeting)

fields.name: Regressive
fields.desc: • No Product Owner

fields.name: Emerging
fields.desc:
Product Owner:
• Not available to team (-)
• No effective stakeholder management in place (-)
• Proxy Product Owner in place (-)

fields.name: Growing
fields.desc:
Product Owner:
• Does not have the right authority (-)
• Rarely present or available (-)
• Unclear on accountabilities (-)
• Multiple Product Owners with conflicting priorities (-)

fields.name: Sustainable
fields.desc:
Product Owner:
• has authority to make decisions
• is available to team
• manages the backlog effectively
• manages the external stakeholders well
• Has clear roadmap and vision

fields.name: Regressive
fields.desc: • No Iteration Manager identified

fields.name: Emerging
fields.desc:
• Iteration Manager is a full time role (-)
• Iteration Manager drives the basic agile fundamentals (-)
• No Standardised Reporting or metrics in place (-)

fields.name: Growing
fields.desc:
• Regular Agile reporting is in place (+)
• Iteration Manager facilitates most of the Agile ceremonies. (-)
• Effective impediment removal in place (+)
• IM can train team members in Agile fundamentals (+)

fields.name: Sustainable
fields.desc:
• Role can effectively be assumed by different team members 
• Facilitation of Agile ceremonies shared between team members.
• Delivery Metrics used to drive continuous improvement

fields.name: Regressive
fields.desc:
• Progress is not visible
• No Wall exists
• Activity Based Progress Tracking

fields.name: Emerging
fields.desc:
• A basic wall exists (-)
• Information is intermittently maintained (-)
• Wall does not represent current status (-)
• Wall is maintained by few people (-)

fields.name: Growing
fields.desc:
• Information is maintained and accurate and is sufficient to describe current work, backlog, risks, issues and overall progress (+)
• The team is proud to show visitors the visual management tools used, which also explain what the team does (+)
• The team collaborate around the wall regularly (+)
• BVCs are used and updated regularly (e.g. Burn Up Charts) (+)
• Remotely located team members have no access to update the wall (-)

fields.name: Sustainable
fields.desc:
• Wall reflects the current progress of work
• Information is kept regularly updated by the team for the team
• Team members remotely located are able to view and update project wall

fields.name: Regressive
fields.desc: • No showcases

fields.name: Emerging
fields.desc:
• Showcases happen at irregular intervals (-)
• There is no representation from outside the team (-)

fields.name: Growing
fields.desc: • The team has started to hold showcases after each iteration but occasionally they get cancelled due to delivery pressure or perceived lack of "something to show" (-)

fields.name: Sustainable
fields.desc:
• Customer is involved
• We demonstrate real deliverables

fields.name: Regressive
fields.desc:
• There is no quality plan and no verification is done to assess the quality of what is delivered.
• Quality is an afterthought and significant rework is often required
• Customer not happy with the quality of deliverables

fields.name: Emerging
fields.desc:
• Team have a shared understanding of how quality is defined (+)
• Limited visibility of project/system health amongst team or stakeholders (-)
• A specialised team/group takes responsibility for quality (-)
• For technology assets: Tests are written and manually executed to verify basic functionality/deliverables (-)

fields.name: Growing
fields.desc:
• A quality plan is agreed and understood by the team that incorporates specific measures and targets(+)
• Definitions of "Ready" and "Done" are defined and agreed by the core team (+)
• Test and verification planning is based on risk associated with technical complexity and business impact (+)
• The team has ownership for quality (+)
• For technology assets, testing is largely automated in a scalable fashion (+)

fields.name: Sustainable
fields.desc:
• All stories/work have clearly defined acceptance criteria
• A quality strategy exists and is measured against frequently
• Target quality is reliably achieved
• Quality is displayed on a Big Visible Chart/Display

fields.name: Regressive
fields.desc:
• No plans exist (release or iteration)
• Plans are created without input from team before delivery
• Plans are based upon one major (big bang) release without consideration of smaller incremental releases

fields.name: Emerging
fields.desc:
• Release Plans (and/or Iteration Plans) are defined by the Project Manager/Iteration Manager with limited involvement from the core team and with limited consideration of business priority or involvement of stakeholders (-)
• Release Plans and Iterations Plans are not adjusted to reflect changing priorities. (-)
• Variations in planned vs. delivered are not consistently measured or reported. (-)

fields.name: Growing
fields.desc:
• Release Plans (and/or Iterations Plans) are visible to the team (+)
• Variations in planned vs. delivered are measured and reported. (+)
• Release Plans and Iterations Plans are not adjusted due to variations in planned vs. delivered work. (-)

fields.name: Sustainable
fields.desc:
• Release and iteration planning produces an achievable plan that the team is confident to deliver
• Work planned is regularly achieved with only small variations in progress
• An overall (long-term) plan is maintained and accurately reflects the team's understanding of work, timing, resources, dependencies, etc.
• Sliders are used to inform planning
• Long-term plan is adjusted every iteration and agreed with customer(s)

fields.name: Regressive
fields.desc:
• Risks are not identified and not effectively managed
• Risk management:
- Does not exist
- Is an afterthought or "bolted-on"
- Just a box to tick in order to get through a process
- Something to keep risk and audit people happy

fields.name: Emerging
fields.desc:
• Risks Identified by Team and Customer [no active management] (+)
• Single Team Register of risks (+)
• Risks are visible to the team (+)

fields.name: Growing
fields.desc:
• Risks regularly reviewed (+)
• Risks have controls and mitigations (+)
• Risks are escalated if outside team authority (+)
• Risk mitigation is treated as normal work (+)
• Risks consequence and impact Identified (+)

fields.name: Sustainable
fields.desc:
• Risk appetite is used as a guide for decision making
• Every Team Member knows the top 3 risks
